page.title: 14Customs in the Northill Area
page.content: Since the 16th Century, a{May Festival has taken place on Ickwell Green and many families from Northill have cont- ributed to its success. Bank Holiday Monday, now the usual date, sees the children and 'Old Scholars' (adults who have attended the school) decorate a float & hoops with flowers, don long dresses or peasant smocks and assemble by the pond. The May Queen and her attendants, chosen from the Parish every third year, head the procession to Ickwell accompanied by music from a brass band, in readiness for the crowning ceremony and maypole dancing. The event always draws a large crowd. {Carol Singing}is well supported with a group of enthusiasts touring the area during the week preceding Christmas. Nowadays, few families seem to honour {'Guy Fawkes'}on November 5th, but tend to join organised parties locally.
